title: Riot enables ARURF due to Clash ending prematurely

replies.body: Better than clash. Works for me.
Only issue I have is they removed the ability to trade, so it's next to impossible to play who you want.
That’s a bug. It’ll happen when they just re-enable a mode without going through testing and prep and such. They said they’ll have it working next time arurf is actually scheduled to come back.
That's a pretty massive bug though.  That means if I want to play a specific champion, I have a less than 1% chance of getting them.
Yeah, that's why they usually take several months to test and bugfix the gamemodes before putting them on live. Which they didn't have time for this time.
why would a mode that has been proven functional and NOT CHANGED suddenly be bugged?

Because things have changed around it. (quick example) Tire goes flat, you fix the hole, tire goes flat again. You fixed the hole, but the tire isn't the problem it's that there's nails all over the road now. More specifically, the in-game part of the mode hasn't changed, but the client, and champ-select screen, have gone through a few tweaks since last time.

It -might- even be a super easy fix, but it would still require a few man-hours to locate the problem, fix the problem, and then test that it's actually fixed (repeat as needed).
Releasing ARURF was an admitted rush job, shove it out the door, have one guy check if anything is outright not working and only 'quick-fix' (>disable) anything that isn't working instead of actual-fixes.
Presumably most/all of the man-hours that could be spent fixing ARURF problems are being allocated to the Clash-Crash issue instead, as that's the primary problem.
was 5 bans active last urfar ? im not sure i even played it . when was the last time ?
I'm with you here

Wait, did they actually?
EDIT: nice
Riot still fucked up for not bringing back the actual URF that was actually fun unlike the shitfest of better team comp wins ARURF

ARURF is better than URF. Urf was literally "play these few champions or you dont play at all". At least if youre randomed a good champion it wasnt because you decided to pick garen/shaco/teemo for the 10,000th game in a row.
Id rather play champions I enjoy and want to try out in URF rather then play champions I don't particularly like playing for 20 or so minutes.
Statistics say otherwise.

Stats don't matter in fun game types.

People play fun game types to have fun.

One person might have fun with garen, teemo, etc.

While others might like playing LB, Kata, Akali.

Some might like sona and shen.

You can't say that because 10% of players picked those champions you don't want the option to freely pick the champion you want to play.
More people stop playing LoL after urf than aruf.
Implying? No, its been proven. Its the only reason riot made the rotating queue instead of implimenting urf as a permanent game type. Riot even released the statistics publicly in a dev QA.
All that their statistics showed was that player counts drop after each URF. They do not show the reasons for it.

And if you take 1 and add it to 1, you get 2. They hypothesized why, changed it up, and had a lower drop off with aruf. Its safe to assume the reason is players burnt out over the fast paced game type playing as and against the same handful of champions. Players were less likely to burn out playing the same game type with random picks.

> [{quoted}](name=Pika Fox,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=dGzEPuOh,comment-id=0001000000000000000100000001000000000000,timestamp=2018-05-26T17:23:43.643+0000)
>
> Its safe to assume the reason

This is what I'm pointing out to you. You're just assuming. You don't actually have anything but speculation to back this up.
And it's not like normals were any more diverse. How many Yasuos do you see in comparison to Taliyahs? How many Ezreals in comaprison to Corkis? How many Lee Sins compared to Rek'sais?

A proper scientific test with two sets of data to compare to with a hypothesis pretty much confirmed to be true is more than "speculation". Riot made a hypothesis and implemented change to see what happened. As expected, falloff rates dropped while play rates didnt. Thats more than just speculation.
What I'm telling you isn't "no, there is no difference in the player count drops". I'm saying "the reason for the difference could very well be different".
Just because there is no explanation that doesn't mean you should assume any random explanation to be right. Assumptions won't make things any clearer.

did riot compare the stats of aram before and during ARURF?

what if, the reason play rate stayed the same, is because aram players shifted to ARURF

except, the reason that happened is because riot started changing its marketing strategy to appeal to players in the East, vastly increasing the playerbase without fixing problems that were present.

a large number of players admitted that they loved league, but as time went on, they only signed on for special events such as URF, vastly increasing the falloff when the events are over
And riot already stated they accounted for people who joined just for urf/arurf, so that doesnt hold water.

They made a false conclusion, made a change based on their bias and got the result they expected, that's bad science (not to mention hubris). 

The real reason people left after real URF was that it was only around once in blue moon, so people binged like crazy on it and got burnt out. If it was around often people wouldn't do that, and wouldn't get burnt out. ARURF isn't nearly as fun because you don't get to pick who you want, so you stop yourself from playing before you get burnt out because you get bored of playing characters you have no interest in playing.
That doesnt hold up, as again, URF and ARURF have similar play rates. And you cant claim ARURF is "less fun". Thats not objective and has no basis in reality.

Similar playrates is popularity, not addictiveness. They are related statistics, but still have differences. You clearly have the same bias and hubris as RIot, and see it through the same lens so don't talk to me about no basis in reality when you understand it so poorly.

People like you hold up the fact that ARURF has a similar player numbers as evidence that "Hey its just as fun or popular as URF" ignoring the fact that in the absence of real URF, OF COURSE people are going to play the only thing Riot does that's close. But the fact that you'd even defend Riot given the things they've done recently shows how braindead you are.

> [{quoted}](name=Pika Fox,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=dGzEPuOh,comment-id=00010000000000000001000000010000000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2018-05-27T01:14:53.111+0000)
>
> Youre that deep in denial eh?

No it  you who are deep in denial

I believe psychologists call that projecting. He's doing it pretty hard because the facts and logic he thought he built his argument on just fell apart like a poorly stacked house of cards lols. Fanboys amiright?

Exactly. If you really think about it the REAL reason player numbers dropped after URF was that people knew it only came around once in a blue moon so they BINGED THEIR ASSES OFF and naturally got burnt out on league altogether. 

If it was around all the time, people wouldn't go hard in the yard on it, and you wouldn't lose players. But expecting riot to understand basic human psychology is far too big an ask. Especially recently.

*cringes and remembers RIOT Lyte [god the dude was fucking insane, the head psychologist at RIOT behind such wonderful changes as autofill and dynamic queue happened to be a stalker/voyeur who was cheating on his fiance at the time with three other women and was addicted to sex at the time]*

Yeah, RIOT sure knows their psychology. . .
That doesn't mean that ARURF was more fun, it could mean the exact opposite actually.
Similar numbers play both. Urf is more likely to burn you out as youre forced to play the same small group of champions repeatedly.

You aren't forced too though, and the data you mention does not specifically mean that.

What I think is more likely is that in normal URF, people play their favorite champions a ton and feel extremely powerful with them.  Then when they go back to the regular game, they feel so much weaker and don't feel like playing so much.

I think it's likely that regular URF is just so fun (in a short dose) that normal games feel slow and boring.
Has nothing to do with "regular urf is so fun". If that were the case riot would just release urf and print money off urf as the main game.
No because URF does begin to drag after a bit.  The issue is the regular game also drags a bit after URF.
Which is fixed by ARURF, because you dont see the same 3 champions get played or you lose, and you dont play the same champion to death and bore yourself out. ARURF is better in literally every way.

Unless you want to play specific champions and not get stuck playing bruisers every fucking game when you're a mage main.

I think I know what I like better than you do.

Ok here I'll tell you it simply.  The move that gets the most playtime out of us is **_not_** necessarily the move that makes the players happiest.

If you need an example, look at candycrush.
More like 95% of players

Statistics don't say otherwise. They don't get to speak for people's personal tastes. You cannot tell someone their opinion is wrong because statistics say otherwise. ARURF just means someone else is going to get one of the fun champions and you get to sit and watch. There is absolutely zero fun when someone else gets ezreal and you just sit on yasuo. Or getting five dodges in a row because guess what? People actually want to play their favorite champions still. So many people on the forums ask about bringing back regular URF.
No, they say otherwise. Fewer people stop playing LoL after aruf than urf.
Because urf is more enjoyable than arurf is compared to normal league not because people are mad at the game because they lost to zed
No, its because they burn out faster with urf, not because its "more fun".
Maybe because less people play the new urf mode?
No. Again, play rates are similar.
